pullrequest.title: Add bloom and lens flare plugins

content.raw:
You can tweak with the [BlurWeight](#!/osrf/citysim/src/2a74883706191a7028fac10cb64429e1c664145a/media/materials/scripts/Bloom2.material?fileviewer=file-view-default#Bloom2.material-324) value in Bloom2.material file. Increasing the number, increases the bloom effect. I also played around with the blur effect by changing [rt0 and rt1 texture scale size](#!/osrf/citysim/src/2a74883706191a7028fac10cb64429e1c664145a/media/materials/scripts/Bloom2.compositor?fileviewer=file-view-default#Bloom2.compositor-8) in the compositor. A larger texture seems to generate more pixelated blurriness around the edges of objects.

For lens flare, you'll need to change the [lens flare fragment shader](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/d7eee41ed4f1ec8a02bc9eb79db953cb5f958e82/media/materials/programs/camera_lens_flare_fs.glsl?at=citysim&fileviewer=file-view-default) in gazebo's citysim branch directly. Are you looking to change the size or color?
content.html:
You can tweak with the BlurWeight value in Bloom2.material file. Increasing the number, increases the bloom effect. I also played around with the blur effect by changing rt0 and rt1 texture scale size in the compositor. A larger texture seems to generate more pixelated blurriness around the edges of objects.

For lens flare, you'll need to change the lens flare fragment shader in gazebo's citysim branch directly. Are you looking to change the size or color?
